page.title: 09BUSTON FARM,KINGS SUTTON.
page.content: THE FARM HAS A VICTORIAN FARMHOUSE ON TOP OF THE HILL AND 460 ACRES.THE PRESENT TENANT IS SELF-EMPLOYED AND HAS BEEN AT BUSTON FARM FOR 7 YEARS.THEY HAVE{100 FRIESIAN COWS}WHICH ARE MILKED TWICE A DAY.THE MILK IS STORED IN A TANK WHICH KEEPS IT COOL UNTIL IT IS COLLECTED.EVERY MORNING A TANKER COMES AND TAKES THE MILK TO AYLESBURY.THE CALVES ARE EITHER USED TO REPLACE THE OLD COWS NO LONGER GOOD FOR MILKING OR GO TO MARKET.THE HEREFORD BULL IS USED TO GET THE 3 YEAR OLD HEIFERS IN CALF FOR THE FIRST TIME.ONCE THEY HAVE HAD THEIR FIRST CALF THEY ARE MILKED BY MACHINE EVERY DAY SO ARTIFICIAL INSEMINATION IS USED.CALVES ARE BORN IN THE EARLY AUTUMN AND ARE TAKEN FROM THEIR MOTHERS AFTER 3 DAYS.THE COWS ARE MILKED FOR 10 MONTHS OF THE YEAR AND DRIED OFF TO REST FOR 2 MONTHS.THE COWS ARE KEPT IN THE BARNS ALL WINTER.
